newsitem.title: PANAMA: Panama reopens convention center concession bid.
newsitem.headline: Panama reopens convention center concession bid.

text.p: Panama will reopen on May 22 the pre-qualification process to operate the nation's only convention center in Panama City, a government spokesman said.
During the first pre-qualification process held last month, he said one international company failed to present documents on time and another firm did not submit them correctly.
Spanish hotel chain Sol Melia and U.S. companies Carnival Corp and Casino America Inc have expressed interest in re-submitting their documents, the spokesman with Panama's privatization program said.

The concession contract to operate the seaside Atlantico- Pacifico (ATLAPA) convention center includes an option to build a five-star hotel with casino on 15 acres (six hectares) of land across the street from the 14,000 square-meter center.
The government intends to announce bids in October with construction to begin by the end of the year, the spokesman said.
